fields.summary: Login attempts return 500 error when ufshost is unreachable

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce...
1. Disconnect from VPN or enter a bogus UFS host in console.ini
2. Fire up console and visit login page

Console throws Internal Server Error, with the following captured in the log...

    [('item', RegionInfo)], verb='POST')

gaierror: [Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known
{code}
fields.summary: Login attempt returns 500 error when ufshost is unreachable

comments.body:
This is odd. If ufshost is unreachable, then the user authentication will fail before trying to fetch region or acct attributes.
If there aren't any creds in the session, we don't try to fetch region either. Need to test this use case more.
[~alice], [~ccassler], will this bug block QA if not fixed right away? If so, please let us know and we can pull it into the current sprint.

This seems to affect other pages as well (e.g. instances landing page).  To reproduce, reload the instances landing page after disconnecting from the network (e.g. disconnect VPN).

I often run into this when testing locally, so it would be good to fix this in the next sprint or so.
I'm testing on elb monitoring page and see the problem in master and maint-4.2, but I also see the difference in behavior on the dashboard.

I've addressed this by catching the error and sending the user back to the login screen with a notification about being unable to reach the host. The login process tends to have better error handling when there are connectivity problems, so when the user tries logging in again, they'll get the best possible messaging.
Some landing pages don't wrap all of the API calls with an error handler, so I'm updating the ones I find lacking.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1846

See if this addresses your failure case.

[~jloza]: Lemme know if you want to UX review this.  I've code-reviewed PR 1846 and it looks good.   When the UFS host is unreachable (e.g. disconnect from VPN after logging in and navigating to the instances landing page to reproduce), the warning notification shown in the attached screenshot is now displayed after redirecting from the instances landing page to the login page.
hi [~kgill] no need for UX review here. Thanks for asking!
